blocks.text: Let $l$ be the length in ins. and $W$ the load at the free end. Consider a section at distance $D$ from the end; then the diam. here is $D_{n} = D - D_{1}$.

Hence the skin stress is given by:

$$\tau = \frac{D}{D_{n}} \cdot 64$$
Where we have used $I_{1} = \frac{W D^{3}}{K}$, where $K = 32 W$ (a constant), and
If $f$ is maximum when the denominator is a minimum.
Thus the stress is maximum at a section distant $D_{1} \text{ ins. from the free end.}$
